sub_title: Researcher Smart Farming Technology | Royal Agrifirm Group
summary:
I'm a Licentiate / Bachelor / Master and Ph.D. in Physics with 3 postdocs (UFJF-Brazil, Institut d’Astrophysique de Paris-France, Brazilian Center for Research in Physics-Brazil). 

Currently working at Royal Agrifirm's R&D Arable group in Apeldoorn, Netherlands, in the position of "Researcher Smart Farming Technology". My main focus is on engineering applications in the agro-industrial sector and their physical analysis, mainly in the use of sensors to improve crops and reduce the waste of resources.

awards.title: Approvals
awards.description:
Approved for postdoctoral grant by FAPESP in 2014, FAPEMIG in 2014, CAPES in 2015, CNPQ in
2015 and again CAPES in 2016. Approved for Substitute Professor at Department of Physics and
Mathematics of the Federal University of São João del Rei - Campus Alto Paraopeba, Public Notice
CPD 088. Approved for Substitute Professor of Department of Physics of the Federal University of
Juiz de Fora, Public Notice 02/2017, No 23071.000540 / 2017-10. Approved for Substitute Professor
at the Federal Institute of Education, Science and Technology of Southeast Minas Gerais - Campus
Barbacena, Notice 39/2016. I was the representative of postgraduate students in Physics at UFJF
(Master / Doctorate), from 2009 to 2012.

projects.title: ASTRIIS - Atlantic Sustainability Through Remote and Integrated In-situ Solution
projects.description: ASTRIIS is a project that aims to develop technical and scientific knowledge for the design and implementation of integrated and customizable information products and services (and respective pilot demonstrators) as well as their application and exploration in sectors of the Economy of the Sea.

contributors.headline: Researcher Smart Farming Technology | Royal Agrifirm Group

projects.title: BIOMA - project - Integrated BIOeconomics Solutions for the Mobilization of the Agrifood chain
projects.description: Promote the adoption of technological solutions in the agrifood value chain, reduce food waste, valuing residues and agri-food by-products for the development of bio-based products, supporting the priorities and aspirations of global sustainable development for 2030 (sustainable development goals - SDGs), supporting the national strategy for the bioeconomy and contributing to the strategy national and European digitization of the industry.

contributors.headline: Researcher Smart Farming Technology | Royal Agrifirm Group

projects.title: SMARTGREENHOUSE - Digital platform that monitors greenhouses
projects.description:
As part of the MaisTec project, an IoT device, a digital platform for monitoring greenhouses, SmartGreenHouse, was developed. The objective focuses on the contribution of sustainable agriculture by increasing knowledge of the culture media and intervening variables.

The IoT device allows to measure in real time several indicators, eg temperature, air humidity, luminosity, humidity in the soil (substrate culture), irrigation solution electroconductivity (hydroponics culture), irrigation solution pH (hydroponics culture) , CO2, O2, air quality.

profile_positions.description:
During this period I develop my skills as a teacher, where I could learn more about modern teaching
techniques. The following courses were given by me during this period (for electrical engineering,
telecommunications engineering, chemical engineering and civil engineering):

Electromagnetism (theory), experimental physics I (mechanical), experimental physics II
(thermodynamics) and experimental physics III (electromagnetism)
